info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 01 at 12:47PM MDT until July 01 at 3:30PM MDT by NWS El Paso
info.description: The National Weather Service in El Paso Tx/Santa Teresa has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... The Black Fire burn scar in... West Central Sierra County in south central New Mexico... Northeastern Grant County in southwestern New Mexico... * Until 330 PM MDT. * At 1247 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain over the Black Fire Burn Scar and surrounding region. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Excessive rainfall over the burn scar will result in debris flow moving through the Upper Mimbres River. Heavy rainfall south of the Burn scar will also result in dangerous flash flooding. The debris flow can consist of rock, mud, vegetation and other loose materials. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms in and around the Black Fire Burn Scar. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flooding of areas in and around the Black Fire Burn Scar. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... San Lorenzo, Emory Pass, Sherman, Mimbres, San Juan, Cooney, Camp Thunderbird and Upper Mimbres Valley. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: This is a life threatening situation. Heavy rainfall will cause extensive and severe flash flooding of creeks...streams...and ditches in the Black Fire Burn Scar. Severe debris flows can also be anticipated across roads. Roads and driveways may be washed away in places. If you encounter flood waters...climb to safety. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
